sentences.en: His paintings had become more impressionistic as his eyesight dimmed.
sentences.cn: 伴随着他视力的下降，他的画作变得更富印象派风格。

sentences.en: How about this landscape ? It is an impressionistic painting.
It looks like an impressionistic painting.
Many conservatives in the early 1900's thought impressionistic art was decadent.
sentences.cn: 20世纪初,许多保守主义者认为印象派的艺术是颓废的.

sentences.en: Many impressionistic painters'inspiration stems from the brilliant sunshine.
sentences.cn: 许多印象派画家的灵感来源于明媚的阳光.

sentences.en: She had impressionistic memories of her childhood.
sentences.cn: 她凭印象对自己的童年有些记忆.

sentences.en: The canvas Yin Xiang Ri Chu is the cornerstone of impressionistic paintings.
sentences.cn: 《印象日出》这幅油画,是印象派绘画的奠基石.

sentences.en: The style of his novels is impressionistic.
sentences.cn: 他那些小说的风格是属于印象派的.

sentences.en: Through his early impressionistic works, he became one of the most popular artist in China.
sentences.cn: 通过早期印象派风格的作品, 他成为中国最受欢迎的艺术家之一.

words.tran_cn: 印象；效果，影响；压痕，印记；感想
印象主义者；印象派作家
盖印；强征；传送；给予某人深刻印象
印象派的；印象主义的；给人深刻印象的

trans.tran_cn: 仅凭印象的，主观的，印象派的；印象主义的；给人深刻印象的
trans.tran_en: An impressionistic work of art or piece of writing shows the artist's or writer's impressions of something rather than giving clear details
